label.value: Classification of the item.

Description of the item.
Unique ID for the item in CS.
The status of the item.
The version of the item.
The priority of the item.
The responsible department.
Actual start date of the activity.
Actual end date of the activity.
The estimated effort given by a person that is needed to complete the Activity. The effort is measured in man/days.
Planned start date of the item.
Planned end date of the item.
The file name of the file.
Mimentype of the file: jpg, png, etc.
The size of the uploaded file.
The date of adding data about the item in the system.
The creator of the item in the system.
The date of last modification of the data about the item in the system.
The person that last modified the item in the system.
The person that has locked the item in the system.
The Primary Images that represents the Cultural Object.
The Cultural object that the image represents.
The item, that the image depicts.
A depiction of the item.
The thumbnail image of the item.
The item, that the image is thumbnail of.
The attachments of the current item.
The item to which the current item is attached to.
The Sample which is taken from the Cultural Object.
The Cultural Object that the sample is taken from.
The Document related to the Cultural Object.
The cultural object/sample documented in the document.
The Cultural object that duplicates the current one.
The users added as watchers for the ithem.
The ithems the user is watcher of.
The object to which the current item is parent of.
The object that is parent of the current item.
The object to which the current item is part of.
Specifies which are the children of the item.
The revisions of the document.
The document to which the current document is revision of.
The last approved and published revisions of the document.
The last revisions of the document.
The revision that succeeds the current.
The revision that is successor of other revision.
Indicates the template of the item.
The Activity that the Cultural Object is involved.
The person who is assignee of the activity.
List with reviewers of the activity.
The participants in the activity.
The person who is supervisor of the activity.
Cultural objects related to the activity.
The Author of the item.
Processes activity.
Barcode number assigned to all individually cataloged or boxes at archival level.
Unique institutional ID. Can be coded to be human readable and to express, for example, year/lot/number if acquisition or shelf location.

Used for multi-volume sets (bound), archival collections; or microforms to provide a more specific identification, especially for archival collections where individual objects are not assigned unique ID numbers.
Number associated with folder from an archival collection, as listed in collection finding aid.
An entity primarily responsible for creating an object.

A start/end dates and qualifiers such as "circa", "before", etc. Can have historical records of former attributions of creation dates. Place and date of publication or creation. Derived from 260 field in MARC record.
Free text description of any writing or printing on the object's obverse or reverse. Artist signature, dealer marks, inventory codes, etc.
Description of any marks not related to the image such notations or marks made by a processes.
Physical description as recorded in CMS.
Cultural object weight.
Free text indicating the public credit line for the object.
Free text describing the historical ownership of the object.
Location could be a gallery or storage location where the cultural object normally is stored or shelved.
Medium description often used for public.
Indication of a group of works of art created as a group.
Number of pieces or separate components that are part of a single object.
Owner of the Art Object.
Curator or collection manager responsible the object and for approving any conservation.
Library department, or collection responsible for the object.
Used for archival collections where there is no 1:1 relationship between objects and records in CMS. Provides more specific data for item to help distinguish it from others in the same collection.
Location of object while in custody of conservation department.
Defines the system from which the object is imported: CMS/DAM.
Characterization of the ethnic or geographical origin of the object.
Description of time period of object.
Characterization of the functional class of the object based on its primary use.
Technical description the materials comprising the artifact.
Unique ID for object record (primary key...often from authoritative system of record, e.g., Collection Space, TMS, Mimsy, Voyager).
Technical description of the format of the audio/visual record.
Technical description of the interior container or case.
Technical description of the outer container.
Actual running time of the recording in minutes.
Maximum capacity of the format in minutes.
Speed associated with the format.
Name of manufacture of the physical format used to make the recording or film.
Binding period.
Technical description of the binding style, materials and construction.
Technical description of stamping, labels, or decoration to the binding.
Technical description of any furniture added as closures to the binding.
Technical description of the endbands, construction, style and materials.
Technical description of the edges of the textblock and any treatment to them.
Technical description of the endsheets .
Technical description of the textblock support leaves.
Technical description of the manner of leaf attachment/construction of the textblock.
Technical description of the printing and media in the textblock.
Description of the printer's imposition and organization of the gatherings in a textblock, expressed in a shorthand formula.
Technical description of any watermarks, includes type, location on sheet, motif, and size.
Description of purpose for which the art of object was created.
Technical description of fabrication.
Technical description of any decorative embellishments.
Technical description of any coatings applied to surface of object.
Technical description of the primary support or substrate of the document, inlcudes color, surface texture, thickness.
Text describing the medium or media used on the document.
Technical description of any secondary support present.
Technical description of any attachments or material additions to the document.
Used to characterize whether the document lays flat, is folded or rolled.
Technical description of any watermarks, includes type, location on sheet, motif, and size.
Yes or No.
Technical description of any may present.
Technical description of the frame's design and construction.
Technical description of any backing used in framing.
Technical description of any glazing used in framing.
Technical description of the sizing and ground construction.
Technical description of any linings -materials and application.
Technical description of the stretcher/ strainer if used.
Technical description of any surface coating applied.
Technical description of the photographic process used to create image.
Technical description of the layer of material that holds the light-sensitive.
Technical description of any colorant or other media applied to the image surface.
Technical description of the case construction (only for cased images).
Indicate standard plate size (only for cased images).
Is photograph a cased image?
Technical description of the printing method(s) used to create the image.
Describes the dimensions of the image area or area within the printing plate mark.
Choice one to generally characterize the composition of the material.
Technical description of any preparation of the specimen.
Description of location status.
The cultural object associated with the current cultural object.
General characterization of the material type.
Date that the Sample was created or taken from the object.
Name of individual who collected the Sample.
Text including measurement and start point for Sample location.
Text including measurement and start point for Sample location.
Text describing a quality of the Sample such as red, blue, green, yellow, etc.
Measured weight of the Sample collected.
Free text describing any actions to the Sample for processing.
The purpose of the item.
Total number of objects listed on the receipt.
Date when the object is in the department.
Date when the object is returned.
Text description of the type and quantity of containers in the shipment.
The person who has packed the object.
The person who has checked the object.
The date when the object is packed.
Total number of outgoing objects listed on the receipt.
Identifies if the document is for single object or multiple objects.
General note on overall condition of the object.
Start date of Loan.
End date of Loan.
Event.
Time value for how long the item was out.
Lighting levels on item.
Name and contact information for the provider of the services.
Staff who is managing the outsourced work; primary contact.
Yale provider.
Other provider.
Any condition issues related with the cultural object.
Any additional condition notes related to the cultural object.
Identifies the person, responsible for the review of the cultural object.
The date when the review was done.
Definition on how did this item come to your attention.
Description of the cultural object treatment needs.
Any digitization recommendations.
Any outstanding conservation actions.
The number of exhibit case, it is different for each exhibition area.
Numbering for the object in each case location.
Notes from the curator who is working on the exhibition.
Notes from the conservator who is working on the exhibition.
Notes from the Curatorial Assistant's who is working on the exhibition.
Notes related to the exhibition.
Primary page for the exhibition.
Instructions if there are additional pages for opening, when this happen.
Imaging needed for catalogues is needed for printing of any kind.
The date by which the imaging has to be done.
Description of the mount.
Description of the stock frame size.
Related cultural object type.
All activities which are in relation to the current conservation record.
Any additional information for needed treatment.
General description of the condition.
Width of object (cm) depicted on the image. The value is used for the ruler in Mirador.
Height of the object (cm) depicted on the image.
The dimension unit of the width and height of the object.
Describes the illumination of the image.
Describes the location on the object shown in the image.
Treatnebt state of image.
Source of the image; photographer, publication, lab.
Indicates the scale if one is.
Describes magnification level under which the image was created
Unique ID for object record (primary key often from authoritative system of record).
Reason for suspension of the item.
Loan, Outgoing # (LNO #).
The institution or YUL library/collection that has lent the Cultural Object for the Exhibition.
The exhibition tracking number used in a project; We currently use the prefix EXH-##.
YUL location of the exhibition; may select multiple values.
The Institution that has borrowed the cultural object.
The website of item.
Phone number of the item.
Contact persona for the organization
The organization or the person who has borrowed the loan.
The organization or person who has lent the loan.
User ID.
Avatar of the User.
The first name of the user.
The last name of the user.
The e-mail of the item.
Name of the country of the user.
The address of the item.
Phone number of the user.
Mobile phone number of the user.
ID of the users account in instant messengers.
Name of the organization, the user is working in.
Name of the department, the user is assigned to.
The job position of the user.
The language of the user.
The group the user is member of.
Users that are members of the group.
The activity that the user/group of users is involved in.
The activity the user is assignee to.
The activity the user/group of users is supervisor of.
The document that the user is author of.
Reporter of the item.
Information about the target of the help.
Select an image which to be primary for the Cultural Object
Select depiction(s) for the current item
Select attachment(s) for the current item
Select people that will be subscribed for notifications on the current item
When you select the action, the status of the current item will be changed to "Obsolete"
The Cultural Object will be imported in the system
The Cultural Object data will be updated
When you select the action the document will become approved and locked
When you select the action, the status of the current activity will be changed to "Completed and Locked"
When you select the action, the status of the current item will be changed to "Completed"
When you select the action, the status of the current item will be changed to "In progress"
When you select the action, the status of the current item will be changed to "On hold"
When you select the action, the status of the current item will be changed to "In progress"
Select user to which the current item will be assigned
When you select the action, the status of the current item will be changed to "In progress"
When you select the action, the status of the current item will be changed to "Stopped"
The item will be permanently deleted
When you select the action, an archived revision of the Cultural Object will be created"
When you select the action, a published revision of the document will be created. The previously published version becomes "Obsolete"
When you select the action, a published PDF revision of the document will be created. The previously published version becomes "Obsolete"
Select a document to be created/uploaded in the context of the item
Select a workflow to be executed on the item
Select a task to be created in the context of the item
Select a Activity to be created in the context of the item
When you select the action, this version will be restored
When you select the action, the document on which a workflow is started will be published
When you select the action, a task for updating the document on which the workflow is started will be assigned
When you select the action, the document on which the workflow is started will become rejected. The document could not be edit any more
When you select the action, the workflow will start its execution. The status of the workflow will be changed to In process
When you select the action, the workflow execution will stop. The status of the workflow and the items within it will be changed to Stopped
Update the template of the item to the latest template version. The static content of the item may be lost
Select new template with which the current item to be presented. Any static content of the item will be lost
The button will activate when there is a value in a field 'Final loan decision'. After the action, the process will be completed
The status of the current item will be changed to Resolved
The status of the current item will be changed to In Progress
Select cultural object(s) for the current item
For loand approval
The organization will be deactivated
The organization will be activated
The type of the object the template is for.
The purpose of the template - if the template is used content that is uploaded or for content that is created.
Indicates if the template is primary or not.
Rule description of current template.
Detailed explanation of the task.
Final loan decision of the task.
Reason for stopping the workflow.
The item processed by the activity.
Indicates if the treatment is minor or major.
The date when the task is completed.
The outcome of a task that is part of workflow.
Sub-type of the Issue.
The reporter of the Issue.
Due date of the Issue.
Resolution of the Issue.
Relationship to another issue that duplicates current ones.
References to items affected by the Issue.
Identifies the items that the current issue depends on.
The priority of the Issue.
The person who is assignee of the Issue.
The status of the current item will be changed to Open
